de.wwu.muggl.symbolic.flow.coverage
Class CGCoverage

java.lang.Object
  de.wwu.muggl.symbolic.flow.coverage.CGCoverage

public class CGCoverage
extends java.lang.Object

Provides the functionality to keep track of the coverage of the edges of the ControlGraph.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-03-16
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

                  Method method)
           throws InitializationException
Initialize the control graph coverage object.

Parameters:
vm - The SymbolicalVirtualMachine execution currently runs in.
method - The Method to track coverage for.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - If the supplied SymbolicalVirtualMachine or Method is null.
InitializationException - In cases of non-recoverable initialization exceptions.
Method Detail

updateCoverage

public void updateCoverage(int pc)
Update the coverage according to the instruction number.

This process it simple: The coverage of the edge between the last executed pc and the current pc is set to true if it is not true already. Then the current pc becomes the last executed pc.

To reset this when backtracking, a new CGCoverageTrailElement is generated.

As special values, -2 and -3 can be supplied. -2 means that the last instruction executed was followed by the end of the method (it was a return instruction). -3 means that the last instruction executed lead to an exception being thrown that was uncaught by the method.

Covering method invocation and returning from invocation is taken into account. Since for coverage always the ControlGraph of the currently executed method is updated, the pc on the instruction following the invocation will be supplied to the CoverageController once invocation is finished and control is returned to the calling frame. The lastPc will be that of the invocation instruction.

Parameters:
pc - The current pc of the virtual machine.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the pc does not point to a node or if there cannot be an edge between the last pc and the current pc.

revertCoverage

void revertCoverage(long number,
                    int lastPc,
                    int pc)
Set the coverage of the definition specified by the supplied pc values to false. This method has package visibility only. It is intended to be used by the restore() method of the CGCoverageTrailElement.

Parameters:
number - A number indicating how many elements have been confirmed to be covered, yet.
lastPc - The last pc value.
pc - The current pc.

revertLastPc

public void revertLastPc(int lastPc)
Set the internal last pc to the value supplied. This is needed for method invocation and for backtracking. The revertCoverage-Method will only revert the coverage of those edges that were not covered before. In many cases the execution of a choice point generating instruction will not result in additional coverage. Hence, the last pc value has to be reverted individually.

Parameters:
lastPc - The last pc value.

commit

public void commit()
Signalize that a solution has been saved any any total coverages can hence be kept and do not need to be unset on backtracking.

isEverythingCovered

public boolean isEverythingCovered()
Check if every control graph edge is covered.

Returns:
true, if full coverage has been reached, false otherwise.

getNumberOfCoveredCGEdges

public long getNumberOfCoveredCGEdges()
Get the number of covered control graph edges. Resetting edges while backtracking is taken into account. The number could however decrease, if currently some branches are covered that will be reseted later.

Returns:
The number of covered control graph edges.

getNumberOfCurrentlyCoveredCGEdges

public long getNumberOfCurrentlyCoveredCGEdges()
Get the number of currently covered control graph edges.

Returns:
The number of currently covered control graph edges.

getNumberOfEdges

public long getNumberOfEdges()
Get the total number of control graph edges. The result of this method will be cached.

Returns:
The total of control graph edges.

getExpectedNumberOfEdges

public long getExpectedNumberOfEdges()
Get the expected number of control graph edges as determined by the corresponding control graph. The result of this method will be cached.

Returns:
The expected number of control graph edges.

getControlGraphCoverage

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,boolean[]>> getControlGraphCoverage()
Get the coverage of control graph edges. This will return a Map with Integer keys and a Map objects. The Map objects have Integer keys and a two-dimensional boolean array. The first Integer key represents the pc of the node the edge comes from. The second Integer key represents the pc of the node the edge goes to. A value of true indicates that the corresponding control graph edge is covered.

Returns:
The coverage control graph edges.

getCoverage

public boolean[] getCoverage()
Get an array of boolean values indicating which control graph edges are covered. A value of true indicates that the corresponding edge is covered. The array is build in the ascending order of the keys.

Returns:
An array of boolean values indicating which control flow edges have been covered.

getCurrentCoverage

public boolean[] getCurrentCoverage()
Get an array of boolean values indicating which control graph edges are currently covered. A value of true indicates that the corresponding edge is covered.

The array is build in the ascending order of the keys.

Returns:
An array of boolean values indicating which control flow edges have been covered currently.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Get a String representation of the control graph edges. This method is an alias for toString(false).

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A String representation of the control graph edges.
See Also:
toString(boolean), showEdges(boolean, boolean)

toString

public java.lang.String toString(boolean showCurrentCoverage)
Get a String representation of the control graph edges.

Please note that the overall coverage reflects backtracking. However, for this reason not all covered edges might stay covered. If currently a branch is processed for that no solution is found, even edges marked as globally covered could be reset.

Parameters:
showCurrentCoverage - Show the current coverage instead of the overall coverage.
Returns:
A String representation of the control graph edges.
See Also:
ControlGraph.toString(), showEdges(boolean, boolean)

showEdges

public java.lang.String showEdges(boolean showInstructionMnemorics,
                                  boolean showCurrentCoverage)
Get a more sophisticated String representation of the control graph edges' coverage. The output will be similar to this:
1
| (covered)
2
| (covered)
3 -> 5 (covered)
| (covered)
4
| (uncovered)
5

Please note that the overall coverage reflects backtracking. However, for this reason not all covered edges might stay covered. If currently a branch is processed for that no solution is found, even edges marked as globally covered could be reset.

Parameters:
showInstructionMnemorics - Do not only display the instructions positions but also their mnemonics.
showCurrentCoverage - Show the current coverage instead of the overall coverage.
Returns:
A more sophisticated String representation of the control graph edges.
See Also:
toString(boolean), ControlGraph.showEdges(boolean)
